           <article class="sc-1yny7o6-3 cFfTrt" data-canoe="true" data-is-churned-or-preview-provider="false" data-location-id="pr_8wdgy2ZQVU-sdZyTVhB-rx|lo_OJIZdxoo3UOig66ASO892h" data-profile-url="/doctor/jay-desai-md-92759" data-search-result-id="6fb7d1b3-ce58-47ee-8f1a-8ccccd585e45" data-search-url="/search?filters=%7B%7D&amp;dr_specialty=106&amp;reason_visit=386&amp;address=&amp;offset=0&amp;insurance_carrier=&amp;insurance_plan=&amp;highlightedProfileIds=%5B%22pr_8wdgy2ZQVU-sdZyTVhB-rx%7Clo_OJIZdxoo3UOig66ASO892h%22%5D&amp;canoe=true" data-test="search-result-item" data-threat-level="SingleSpec" data-uem-id="search-result-item-92759_141208" itemscope="" itemtype="https://schema.org/Physician">
            <div class="sc-1yny7o6-2 gqRtQ">
             <div class="sc-1yny7o6-0 jtDhli">
              <div elementtiming="SearchResultCard">
               <div class="cg621t-11 iqwRwL outer_container">
                <div class="htzklx-18 cg621t-0 kWFFrH" data-test="doctor-card" itemprop="member">
                 <div class="ce7azy-0 ipDcpt" data-test="doctor-card-photo">
                  <div class="ce7azy-0 fGllaV">
                   <picture>
                    <img alt="Dr. Jay Desai" data-src="//d1k13df5m14swc.cloudfront.net/photos/Dr-Jay-Desai-MD-92759-circle_medium.png" data-test="doctor-photo-listing" height="120" itemprop="image" loading="lazy" src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," width="120"/>

                       <svg class="sc-14oxdvn-0 sc-138rgit-0 jMoswN sc-1nu7rd6-3 fqJBPx" data-test="review-verified-icon" viewbox="0 0 300 300" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
                        <title>
                         Verified Patient Review
                        </title>
                        <path d="M283.7 82.8L154.5 208.6h-45.4V90.4h34.7v80.8S262.9 55.3 264.4 53.8C237 21.2 195.9.4 150 .4 67.4.4.2 67.6.2 150.2.2 232.8 67.4 300 150 300s149.8-67.2 149.8-149.8c0-24.2-5.8-47.1-16.1-67.4z" fill="#00E6AF">

                     </div>
                     <div class="sc-192nc1l-0 buuGUE i5k0wr-0 iDjpkc" data-test="collapsible-block" data-testid="statement-content">
                      Dr. Desai is a Clinical Instructor of Medicine at Mount Sinai School of Medicine. He graduated with Research Honors from Tufts University School of Medicine. He subsequently completed his training in Internal Medicine and Gastroenterology at New York University. He has a strong clinical interest in Inflammatory Bowel Disease as well as Colorectal cancer screening. He also has expertise in managing gastrointestinal bleeding, acid reflux, abdominal pain syndromes, constipation, diarrhea, celiac disease, as well as liver disorders. 

His research interests have focused primarily on improving the performance of endoscopy and in studying the effects of commonly prescribed medication on the gastrointestinal tract. He has published extensively in leading gastroenterology journals as well as presented at national gastroenterology conferences, for which he has been recognized with several research awards.
                      <div class="sc-192nc1l-1 ewhUaU hidden" data-test="children-wrap">

                   <div class="sc-192nc1l-0 buuGUE i5k0wr-0 iDjpkc" data-test="collapsible-block" data-testid="statement-content">
                    Dr. Desai is a Clinical Instructor of Medicine at Mount Sinai School of Medicine. He graduated with Research Honors from Tufts University School of Medicine. He subsequently completed his training in Internal Medicine and Gastroenterology at New York University. He has a strong clinical interest in Inflammatory Bowel Disease as well as Colorectal cancer screening. He also has expertise in managing gastrointestinal bleeding, acid reflux, abdominal pain syndromes, constipation, diarrhea, celiac disease, as well as liver disorders. 

His research interests have focused primarily on improving the performance of endoscopy and in studying the effects of commonly prescribed medication on the gastrointestinal tract. He has published extensively in leading gastroenterology journals as well as presented at national gastroenterology conferences, for which he has been recognized with several research awards.

           <article class="sc-1yny7o6-3 cFfTrt" data-canoe="true" data-is-churned-or-preview-provider="false" data-location-id="pr_cN6ELJUDWEiZlBHWQ7I8-x|lo_vgO8TxI6JUavDAWKZFFFUh" data-profile-url="/doctor/mejdi-ahmad-md-333591" data-search-result-id="8e08e5a9-bd1e-49a1-a456-e763d9d2a4ea" data-search-url="/search?filters=%7B%7D&amp;dr_specialty=106&amp;reason_visit=386&amp;address=&amp;offset=0&amp;insurance_carrier=&amp;insurance_plan=&amp;highlightedProfileIds=%5B%22pr_cN6ELJUDWEiZlBHWQ7I8-x%7Clo_vgO8TxI6JUavDAWKZFFFUh%22%5D&amp;canoe=true" data-test="search-result-item" data-threat-level="SingleSpec" data-uem-id="search-result-item-333591_123983" itemscope="" itemtype="https://schema.org/Physician">

               <div class="cg621t-11 iqwRwL outer_container">

                 <div class="ce7azy-0 ipDcpt" data-test="doctor-card-photo">
                  <div class="ce7azy-0 fGllaV">
                   <picture>

                  <div class="htzklx-14 hoozNR">
                   <a class="htzklx-16 cg621t-2 kuhtuQ" data-test="doctor-card-info-name" data-uem-id="doctor-card-info-name" href="/search?filters=%7B%7D&amp;dr_specialty=106&amp;reason_visit=386&amp;address=&amp;offset=0&amp;insurance_carrier=&amp;insurance_plan=&amp;highlightedProfileIds=%5B%22pr_cN6ELJUDWEiZlBHWQ7I8-x%7Clo_vgO8TxI6JUavDAWKZFFFUh%22%5D&amp;canoe=true" rel="nofollow" tabindex="0" title="View the profile of Dr. Mejdi Ahmad, MD">
                    <h3>
                     <span data-test="doctor-card-info-name-prefix" itemprop="honorificPrefix">

                     </span>

                    <!-- -->
                    mi

                       <svg class="sc-14oxdvn-0 sc-138rgit-0 jMoswN sc-1nu7rd6-3 fqJBPx" data-test="review-verified-icon" viewbox="0 0 300 300" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
                        <title>
                         Verified Patient Review
                        </title>
                        <path d="M283.7 82.8L154.5 208.6h-45.4V90.4h34.7v80.8S262.9 55.3 264.4 53.8C237 21.2 195.9.4 150 .4 67.4.4.2 67.6.2 150.2.2 232.8 67.4 300 150 300s149.8-67.2 149.8-149.8c0-24.2-5.8-47.1-16.1-67.4z" fill="#00E6AF">
                        </path>
                       </svg>
                      </div>

                     <div class="sc-192nc1l-0 buuGUE i5k0wr-0 iDjpkc" data-test="collapsible-block" data-testid="statement-content">
                      Dr. Mejdi Ahmad is an accomplished gastroenterologist looking after the locals of Huntington, NY. Dr. Ahmad attended the State University of New York, Downstate Medical Center, where he received his medical degree. He then completed his residency in internal medicine at North Shore University Hospital. Additionally, he completed a fellowship in gastroenterology at Milton S. Hershey Medical Center.

Dr. Ahmad is certified by the American Board of Internal Medicine in both gastroenterology and internal medicine. He currently practices at Mount Sinai Doctors and is also an affiliate of the Mount Sinai Hospital. Patients visit him for the treatment of stomach ulcers, diarrhea, irritable bowel syndrome, and Crohns disease.

Dr. Ahmad believes that the patient-provider relationship should be built on mutual trust and that it plays a crucial part in patient care. He does his best to communicate the information patients need to make the right choices.

                   <div class="sc-192nc1l-0 buuGUE i5k0wr-0 iDjpkc" data-test="collapsible-block" data-testid="statement-content">
                    Dr. Mejdi Ahmad is an accomplished gastroenterologist looking after the locals of Huntington, NY. Dr. Ahmad attended the State University of New York, Downstate Medical Center, where he received his medical degree. He then completed his residency in internal medicine at North Shore University Hospital. Additionally, he completed a fellowship in gastroenterology at Milton S. Hershey Medical Center.

Dr. Ahmad is certified by the American Board of Internal Medicine in both gastroenterology and internal medicine. He currently practices at Mount Sinai Doctors and is also an affiliate of the Mount Sinai Hospital. Patients visit him for the treatment of stomach ulcers, diarrhea, irritable bowel syndrome, and Crohns disease.

Dr. Ahmad believes that the patient-provider relationship should be built on mutual trust and that it plays a crucial part in patient care. He does his best to communicate the information patients need to make the right choices.

                     <div class="sc-192nc1l-0 buuGUE i5k0wr-0 iDjpkc" data-test="collapsible-block" data-testid="statement-content">
                      Dr. Jonathan Erber graduated from Tel Aviv University, Sackler Faculty of Medicine in 2002, completed his Internship and Residency in Internal Medicine at Albert Einstein College of Medicine, Montefiore Medical Center in 2005 and Fellowship in Gastroenterology at SUNY Downstate Medical Center in 2008.

Dr. Jonathan Erber is a member of the American College of Gastroenterology (ACG), the American Gastroenterological Association (AGA), the American Society for Gastrointestinal  Endoscopy (ASGE), the New York Society for Gastrointestinal Endoscopy (NYSGE) and the Brooklyn Gastroenterological Association (BGA).

                        <ul>
                         <li>

                         </li>
                        </ul>

                   <div class="sc-192nc1l-0 buuGUE i5k0wr-0 iDjpkc" data-test="collapsible-block" data-testid="statement-content">
                    Dr. Jonathan Erber graduated from Tel Aviv University, Sackler Faculty of Medicine in 2002, completed his Internship and Residency in Internal Medicine at Albert Einstein College of Medicine, Montefiore Medical Center in 2005 and Fellowship in Gastroenterology at SUNY Downstate Medical Center in 2008.

Dr. Jonathan Erber is a member of the American College of Gastroenterology (ACG), the American Gastroenterological Association (AGA), the American Society for Gastrointestinal  Endoscopy (ASGE), the New York Society for Gastrointestinal Endoscopy (NYSGE) and the Brooklyn Gastroenterological Association (BGA).

                         Verified Patient Review

                        <path d="M283.7 82.8L154.5 208.6h-45.4V90.4h34.7v80.8S262.9 55.3 264.4 53.8C237 21.2 195.9.4 150 .4 67.4.4.2 67.6.2 150.2.2 232.8 67.4 300 150 300s149.8-67.2 149.8-149.8c0-24.2-5.8-47.1-16.1-67.4z" fill="#00E6AF">

                     <div class="sc-192nc1l-0 buuGUE i5k0wr-0 iDjpkc" data-test="collapsible-block" data-testid="statement-content">
                      Dr. Valerie Antoine-Gustave is a gastroenterologist treating patients in New York City, NY. Patients come to Dr. Antoine-Gustave for a number of conditions, such as abdominal pain, stomach ulcers, acid reflux/heartburn, rectal bleeding, diarrhea and colon cancer screening. She also focuses on Women's Digestive Health. 

Dr. Antoine-Gustave holds a Masters degree in public health from Columbia University in New York City. She earned her medical degree at The Johns Hopkins School of Medicine in Baltimore, MD, and completed Residency at New York-Presbyterian Hospital/Weill Cornell Medical Center. Dr. Antoine-Gustave completed her Gastroenterology at Harvard University, Brigham and Womens Hospital in Boston. She is certified by the American Board of Internal Medicine. Dr. Antoine-Gustave speaks English, French, and Creole.
                      <div class="sc-192nc1l-1 ewhUaU hidden" data-test="children-wrap">

                       Mar 19, 2021 by

                       Debra S.

                       <svg class="sc-14oxdvn-0 sc-138rgit-0 jMoswN sc-1nu7rd6-3 fqJBPx" data-test="review-verified-icon" viewbox="0 0 300 300" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
                        <title>
                         Verified Patient Review
                        </title>
                        <path d="M283.7 82.8L154.5 208.6h-45.4V90.4h34.7v80.8S262.9 55.3 264.4 53.8C237 21.2 195.9.4 150 .4 67.4.4.2 67.6.2 150.2.2 232.8 67.4 300 150 300s149.8-67.2 149.8-149.8c0-24.2-5.8-47.1-16.1-67.4z" fill="#00E6AF">
                        </path>
                       </svg>

                     <div class="sc-192nc1l-0 buuGUE i5k0wr-0 iDjpkc" data-test="collapsible-block" data-testid="statement-content">
                      Dr. Mejdi Ahmad is an accomplished gastroenterologist looking after the locals of Huntington, NY. Dr. Ahmad attended the State University of New York, Downstate Medical Center, where he received his medical degree. He then completed his residency in internal medicine at North Shore University Hospital. Additionally, he completed a fellowship in gastroenterology at Milton S. Hershey Medical Center.

Dr. Ahmad is certified by the American Board of Internal Medicine in both gastroenterology and internal medicine. He currently practices at Mount Sinai Doctors and is also an affiliate of the Mount Sinai Hospital. Patients visit him for the treatment of stomach ulcers, diarrhea, irritable bowel syndrome, and Crohns disease.

Dr. Ahmad believes that the patient-provider relationship should be built on mutual trust and that it plays a crucial part in patient care. He does his best to communicate the information patients need to make the right choices.

                   <div class="sc-192nc1l-0 buuGUE i5k0wr-0 iDjpkc" data-test="collapsible-block" data-testid="statement-content">
                    Dr. Mejdi Ahmad is an accomplished gastroenterologist looking after the locals of Huntington, NY. Dr. Ahmad attended the State University of New York, Downstate Medical Center, where he received his medical degree. He then completed his residency in internal medicine at North Shore University Hospital. Additionally, he completed a fellowship in gastroenterology at Milton S. Hershey Medical Center.

Dr. Ahmad is certified by the American Board of Internal Medicine in both gastroenterology and internal medicine. He currently practices at Mount Sinai Doctors and is also an affiliate of the Mount Sinai Hospital. Patients visit him for the treatment of stomach ulcers, diarrhea, irritable bowel syndrome, and Crohns disease.

Dr. Ahmad believes that the patient-provider relationship should be built on mutual trust and that it plays a crucial part in patient care. He does his best to communicate the information patients need to make the right choices.

                     <div class="sc-192nc1l-0 buuGUE i5k0wr-0 iDjpkc" data-test="collapsible-block" data-testid="statement-content">
                      Dr. Daniel Adler is a native of the New York metropolitan area. He received his Bachelors of Engineering from Johns Hopkins University and Doctor of Medicine degree from The State University of New York at Buffalo. He completed six years of post-graduate training including residency in internal medicine, chief medical resident and fellowship in gastroenterology at Lenox Hill Hospital. He is board certified in Internal Medicine and Gastroenterology.

                       <path d="M6.5 0A6.5 6.5 0 1 0 13 6.5 6.507 6.507 0 0 0 6.5 0zm0 11.96a5.46 5.46 0 1 1 5.46-5.46 5.466 5.466 0 0 1-5.46 5.46z" fill="#667385">

                       <svg class="sc-14oxdvn-0 sc-138rgit-0 jMoswN sc-1nu7rd6-3 fqJBPx" data-test="review-verified-icon" viewbox="0 0 300 300" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
                        <title>
                         Verified Patient Review
                        </title>
                        <path d="M283.7 82.8L154.5 208.6h-45.4V90.4h34.7v80.8S262.9 55.3 264.4 53.8C237 21.2 195.9.4 150 .4 67.4.4.2 67.6.2 150.2.2 232.8 67.4 300 150 300s149.8-67.2 149.8-149.8c0-24.2-5.8-47.1-16.1-67.4z" fill="#00E6AF">
                        </path>
                       </svg>
                      </div>
                     </div>
                     <div class="sc-192nc1l-0 buuGUE i5k0wr-0 iDjpkc" data-test="collapsible-block" data-testid="statement-content">
                      Leslie Park is a diligent and compassionate gastroenterologist who believes in partnering with patients to deliver individualized care. She is board-certified in both Gastroenterology and Internal Medicine and her practice encompasses the entirety of general gastroenterology including acid reflux, irritable bowel syndrome, inflammatory diseases, and liver disease. She has a particular interest in colorectal cancer screening and prevention, nutrition, and women's digestive health.

After earning a BA in Political Science and International Relations at Carleton College, she spent a year and a half teaching in South Korea and backpacking throughout Asia. Her experiences traveling were transformative and ultimately led her to pursue a career in medicine.

She completed post-baccalaureate studies at Columbia University and spent time working in a clinical laboratory at Bellevue Hospital prior to medical school. She then earned her medical degree from the University of Rochester School of Medicine, after which she completed her medical internship and residency at New York University Langone Medical Center. After working as an attending hospitalist, she went on to complete a fellowship in Gastroenterology, Hepatology, and Nutrition at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center, during which time she conducted original research on the rising incidence of colorectal cancer in young people.

She is an attending physician at NYU Langone Hospital where she teaches medical students, residents, and gastroenterology fellows. She is a member of the American College of Gastroenterology, American Gastroenterological Association, and the American Society of Gastrointestinal End

                    Leslie Park is a diligent and compassionate gastroenterologist who believes in partnering with patients to deliver individualized care. She is board-certified in both Gastroenterology and Internal Medicine and her practice encompasses the entirety of general gastroenterology including acid reflux, irritable bowel syndrome, inflammatory diseases, and liver disease. She has a particular interest in colorectal cancer screening and prevention, nutrition, and women's digestive health.

She completed post-baccalaureate studies at Columbia University and spent time working in a clinical laboratory at Bellevue Hospital prior to medical school. She then earned her medical degree from the University of Rochester School of Medicine, after which she completed her medical internship and residency at New York University Langone Medical Center. After working as an attending hospitalist, she went on to complete a fellowship in Gastroenterology, Hepatology, and Nutrition at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center, during which time she conducted original research on the rising incidence of colorectal cancer in young people.

                        <path d="M283.7 82.8L154.5 208.6h-45.4V90.4h34.7v80.8S262.9 55.3 264.4 53.8C237 21.2 195.9.4 150 .4 67.4.4.2 67.6.2 150.2.2 232.8 67.4 300 150 300s149.8-67.2 149.8-149.8c0-24.2-5.8-47.1-16.1-67.4z" fill="#00E6AF">

                     <div class="sc-192nc1l-0 buuGUE i5k0wr-0 iDjpkc" data-test="collapsible-block" data-testid="statement-content">
                      Dr. Jonathan Erber graduated from Tel Aviv University, Sackler Faculty of Medicine in 2002, completed his Internship and Residency in Internal Medicine at Albert Einstein College of Medicine, Montefiore Medical Center in 2005 and Fellowship in Gastroenterology at SUNY Downstate Medical Center in 2008.

Dr. Jonathan Erber is a member of the American College of Gastroenterology (ACG), the American Gastroenterological Association (AGA), the American Society for Gastrointestinal  Endoscopy (ASGE), the New York Society for Gastrointestinal Endoscopy (NYSGE) and the Brooklyn Gastroenterological Association (BGA).

                     <div class="sc-192nc1l-0 buuGUE i5k0wr-0 iDjpkc" data-test="collapsible-block" data-testid="statement-content">
                      We understand that Dr. Herman's schedule is very busy, but we would like to help accomodate you. Dr Lawrence Herman specializes in diseases of the digestive tract with a focus on the diagnosis and prevention of gastrointestinal cancers. His medical interests include the diagnosis and treatment of gastroesophageal reflux disorder, peptic ulcer disease, celiac disease, colorectal cancer, irritable bowel syndrome gastrointetinal bleeding and inflammtory bowel disease. We are affiliated with Carnegie Hill Endoscopy, the premier gastrointestinal procedure center in Manhattan.

                     <div class="sc-192nc1l-0 buuGUE i5k0wr-0 iDjpkc" data-test="collapsible-block" data-testid="statement-content">
                      My areas of interest include the diagnosis and treatment of gastroesophageal reflux and esophagitis, ulcer disease, Celiac Disease, Irritable Bowel Syndrome, Inflammatory Bowel Disease, and screening for gastrointestinal cancers. Colonoscopy and Upper GI Endoscopy are performed at Carnegie Hill Endoscopy, a state-of-the-art facility. The revolutionary Fuse endoscope system allows me to see more of the GI tract than ever before. While traditional endoscopes offer a limited field of view (no more than 170 for colonoscope or up to 150 for gastroscope), the Fuse endoscope system provides a significantly expanded field of view (330 for colonoscope; 245 for gastroscope). The LUMOS Adaptive Matrix Image Enhancing System makes it easier to differentiate between small polyps and normal tissue.  An electronic medical record (eClinicalWorks) allows me to assess quality measures, send prescriptions electronically, and communicate with patients through a Patient Portal.Quality Control is provided by the Mount Sinai IPA, which provides me with quarterly metrics scores.

                   <div class="sc-192nc1l-0 buuGUE i5k0wr-0 iDjpkc" data-test="collapsible-block" data-testid="statement-content">
                    My areas of interest include the diagnosis and treatment of gastroesophageal reflux and esophagitis, ulcer disease, Celiac Disease, Irritable Bowel Syndrome, Inflammatory Bowel Disease, and screening for gastrointestinal cancers. Colonoscopy and Upper GI Endoscopy are performed at Carnegie Hill Endoscopy, a state-of-the-art facility. The revolutionary Fuse endoscope system allows me to see more of the GI tract than ever before. While traditional endoscopes offer a limited field of view (no more than 170 for colonoscope or up to 150 for gastroscope), the Fuse endoscope system provides a significantly expanded field of view (330 for colonoscope; 245 for gastroscope). The LUMOS Adaptive Matrix Image Enhancing System makes it easier to differentiate between small polyps and normal tissue.  An electronic medical record (eClinicalWorks) allows me to assess quality measures, send prescriptions electronically, and communicate with patients through a Patient Portal.Quality Control is provided by the Mount Sinai IPA, which provides me with quarterly metrics scores.

                   <a class="htzklx-16 cg621t-2 kuhtuQ" data-test="doctor-card-info-name" data-uem-id="doctor-card-info-name" href="/search?filters=%7B%7D&amp;dr_specialty=106&amp;reason_visit=386&amp;address=&amp;offset=0&amp;insurance_carrier=&amp;insurance_plan=&amp;highlightedProfileIds=%5B%22pr_FbEwvylugEuWo9yjgdhwNR%7Clo_IexU1ayaWEucX8ssCH8zhh%22%5D&amp;canoe=true" rel="nofollow" tabindex="0" title="View the profile of Dr. Kristen Lee, MD">
                    <h3>
                     <span data-test="doctor-card-info-name-prefix" itemprop="honorificPrefix">
                      Dr.
                     </span>
                     <span data-test="doctor-card-info-name-full" itemprop="name">
                      Kristen
                      <!-- -->
                      <!-- -->
                      Lee
                     </span>
                     ,
                     <span data-test="doctor-card-info-name-suffix" itemprop="honorificSuffix">

                     </span>
                    </h3>
                   </a>
                   <div class="cg621t-6 cNOnWR" data-test="doctor-card-info-location-distance">
                    1
                    <!-- -->
                    mi
                   </div>
                  </div>
                  <div class="htzklx-17 cg621t-3 jvQGes" data-test="doctor-card-info-specialty" itemprop="medicalSpecialty">
                   Gastroenterologist

                  <div class="sc-10xr5el-0 gufocQ" data-test="doctor-card-info-location" itemprop="location" itemscope="" itemtype="https://schema.org/PostalAddress">

                    <svg class="sc-14oxdvn-0 cg621t-8 bWgswL" viewbox="0 0 51.6 43">

                      <path d="M32.2 40l-10.7-7.8L10.8 40l-3.7-2.7 4.1-12.6L.5 17l1.4-4.4h13.2L19.2 0h4.6l4.1 12.6h13.2l1.4 4.4-10.7 7.8 4.1 12.6-3.7 2.6z" fill="#FF6473">

                       <path d="M6.5 0A6.5 6.5 0 1 0 13 6.5 6.507 6.507 0 0 0 6.5 0zm0 11.96a5.46 5.46 0 1 1 5.46-5.46 5.466 5.466 0 0 1-5.46 5.46z" fill="#667385">

                      <div class="sc-1nu7rd6-4 jXipCC">
                       Apr 27, 2020 by
                       <!-- -->
                       <!-- -->
                       Genevieve M.
                       <!-- -->
                       <svg class="sc-14oxdvn-0 sc-138rgit-0 jMoswN sc-1nu7rd6-3 fqJBPx" data-test="review-verified-icon" viewbox="0 0 300 300" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
                        <title>
                         Verified Patient Review
                        </title>
                        <path d="M283.7 82.8L154.5 208.6h-45.4V90.4h34.7v80.8S262.9 55.3 264.4 53.8C237 21.2 195.9.4 150 .4 67.4.4.2 67.6.2 150.2.2 232.8 67.4 300 150 300s149.8-67.2 149.8-149.8c0-24.2-5.8-47.1-16.1-67.4z" fill="#00E6AF">
                        </path>
                       </svg>
                      </div>
                     </div>
                     <div class="sc-192nc1l-0 buuGUE i5k0wr-0 iDjpkc" data-test="collapsible-block" data-testid="statement-content">
                      Dr. Kristen Lee is a double board certified, IVY league trained gastroenterologist with special interest in Women's health, colon cancer screening, inflammatory bowel disease (Crohn's disease/ulcerative colitis) IBS (irritable bowel syndrome) and hemorrhoid treatment. Dr. Lee graduated from Johns Hopkins University where she received her Bachelor of Science degree in Biomedical Engineering with honors. She then attended Weill Cornell Medical College where she received her medical degree with academic distinction. Dr. Lee went on to complete her post-graduate training at Mount Sinai Medical Center including her residency in internal medicine and fellowship in gastroenterology. As part of her fellowship, she also perused research in the specialized areas of ethnic disparities in colon cancer screening and in inflammatory bowel disease. 

Dr. Lee has received numerous academic and clinical awards, including The Janet Glasgow-Rubin Memorial Award at Weill Cornell Medical College given to female students who graduate in the top 10% of their class. She also received a research-training award from the National Institutes of Health and was a grant recipient for an aging research program. She is a member of American Gastroenterological Association (AGA), American College of Gastroenterology (ACG) and the American Society of Gastrointestinal Endoscopy (ASGE). She also holds membership with the Crohns and Colitis Foundation of America (CCFA). Dr. Lee has been extensively published in medical literature and has presented various abstracts and other oral presentations in her field.

Dr. Lees passion for patient care and clinical skills have earned her many awards and has earned her one of the finest reputations in NYC. Dr. Lee is affiliated with Weill Cornell Medical Center.

                    Dr. Kristen Lee is a double board certified, IVY league trained gastroenterologist with special interest in Women's health, colon cancer screening, inflammatory bowel disease (Crohn's disease/ulcerative colitis) IBS (irritable bowel syndrome) and hemorrhoid treatment.                        <svg class="sc-14oxdvn-0 sc-138rgit-0 jMoswN sc-1nu7rd6-3 fqJBPx" data-test="review-verified-icon" viewbox="0 0 300 300" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
                        <title>
                         Verified Patient Review
                        </title>
                        <path d="M283.7 82.8L154.5 208.6h-45.4V90.4h34.7v80.8S262.9 55.3 264.4 53.8C237 21.2 195.9.4 150 .4 67.4.4.2 67.6.2 150.2.2 232.8 67.4 300 150 300s149.8-67.2 149.8-149.8c0-24.2-5.8-47.1-16.1-67.4z" fill="#00E6AF">
                        </path>
                       </svg>
                      </div>
                     </div>
                     <div class="sc-192nc1l-0 buuGUE i5k0wr-0 iDjpkc" data-test="collapsible-block" data-testid="statement-content">
                      Dr. Lauren Schwartz is a highly rated, leading Ivy league trained New York gastroenterologist with a special interest in general gastroenterology as well as Womens health, colon cancer screening, inflammatory bowel disease (Crohns disease / Ulcerative Colitis), IBS (Irritable Bowel Syndrome) and is also one a select few gastroenterologists certified in clinical nutrition. Dr. Schwartz has also been consistently voted by her peers among the prestigious group of Castle Connolly Regional Top Doctors as well as NY metro area top doctors yearly from 2017-2021. She was also sited among the list of exceptional Women in Medicine in 2019 and 2020.  Dr. Schwartz is a renowned NYC gastroenterologist with a strong passion for patient care.
Dr. Schwartz received her undergraduate degree from Yale University and graduated magna cum laude with a Bachelor of Science in biology. She then obtained her medical degree from Weill-Cornell Medical College and completed her internal medicine residency at the affiliated Weill Cornell/New York Presbyterian Hospital. Driven by an interest in the nutritional aspects of gastrointestinal disease, she completed a clinical nutrition fellowship at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center and is one of a handful of physicians certified in clinical nutrition. Dr. Schwartz then completed her gastroenterology fellowship at the Mount Sinai Hospital in Manhattan.  
Dr. Schwartz is a member of American Gastroenterological Association (AGA), American College of Gastroenterology (ACG) and the American Society of Gastrointestinal Endoscopy (ASGE), as well as the American Society of Parenteral and Enteral Nutrition. Dr. Schwartz has been extensively published in medical literature and has presented various abstracts and other oral presentations in her field.

                   <div class="sc-192nc1l-0 buuGUE i5k0wr-0 iDjpkc" data-test="collapsible-block" data-testid="statement-content">
                    Dr. Lauren Schwartz is a highly rated, leading Ivy league trained New York gastroenterologist with a special interest in general gastroenterology as well as Womens health, colon cancer screening, inflammatory bowel disease (Crohns disease / Ulcerative Colitis), IBS (Irritable Bowel Syndrome) and is also one a select few gastroenterologists certified in clinical nutrition. Dr. Schwartz has also been consistently voted by her peers among the prestigious group of Castle Connolly Regional Top Doctors as well as NY metro area top doctors yearly from 2017-2021. She was also sited among the list of exceptional Women in Medicine in 2019 and 2020.  Dr. Schwartz is a renowned NYC gastroenterologist with a strong passion for patient care.
Dr. Schwartz received her undergraduate degree from Yale University and graduated magna cum laude with a Bachelor of Science in biology. She then obtained her medical degree from Weill-Cornell Medical College and completed her internal medicine residency at the affiliated Weill Cornell/New York Presbyterian Hospital. Driven by an interest in the nutritional aspects of gastrointestinal disease, she completed a clinical nutrition fellowship at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center and is one of a handful of physicians certified in clinical nutrition. Dr. Schwartz then completed her gastroenterology fellowship at the Mount Sinai Hospital in Manhattan.  
Dr. Schwartz is a member of American Gastroenterological Association (AGA), American College of Gastroenterology (ACG) and the American Society of Gastrointestinal Endoscopy (ASGE), as well as the American Society of Parenteral and Enteral Nutrition. Dr. Schwartz has been extensively published in medical literature and has presented various abstracts and other oral presentations in her field.

                       Recent Patient Review
                      </div>
                      <div class="sc-192nc1l-0 buuGUI sc-1nu7rd6-1 erocNn" data-test="collapsible-block">
                       "Dr. Ammirati is a careful listener, an exceptional diagnostician and a superior doctor in his specialty of gastroenterology."
                       <span class="sc-192nc1l-2 iLPFhr hidden" data-test="show-more-button">
                        <span data-test="collapse-text">
                         ... read more
                        </span>
                       </span>
                       <span class="sc-192nc1l-2 sc-192nc1l-3 irucWS hidden" data-test="show-less-button">

                     <div class="sc-192nc1l-0 buuGUE i5k0wr-0 iDjpkc" data-test="collapsible-block" data-testid="statement-content">
                      We are a fully accredited facility with New York State through the American Association for Accreditation of Ambulatory Surgical Facilities. We have an anesthesiologist present in our facility as well as all required emergency equipment and medicines.

Dr. Ammirati is board certified in Gastroenterology and Internal Medicine.  He is licensed in the state of New York after being educated at New York University and Suny at Stony Brook-School Of  Medicine.  Aside from being a wonderful physician, Dr. Ammirati has also published a few articles on Indeterminate Colitis and Inflammatory Bowel Disease and Immune Thrombocytopenic Purpura.

He and his friendly staff are looking forward to meeting all the new patients!

                     "Dr. Ammirati is a careful listener, an exceptional diagnostician and a superior doctor in his specialty of gastroenterology."
                     <span class="sc-192nc1l-2 iLPFhr hidden" data-test="show-more-button">
                      <span data-test="collapse-text">
                       ... read more

                    </div>

                   <div class="sc-192nc1l-0 buuGUE i5k0wr-0 iDjpkc" data-test="collapsible-block" data-testid="statement-content">
                    We are a fully accredited facility with New York State through the American Association for Accreditation of Ambulatory Surgical Facilities. We have an anesthesiologist present in our facility as well as all required emergency equipment and medicines.

Dr. Ammirati is board certified in Gastroenterology and Internal Medicine.  He is licensed in the state of New York after being educated at New York University and Suny at Stony Brook-School Of  Medicine.  Aside from being a wonderful physician, Dr. Ammirati has also published a few articles on Indeterminate Colitis and Inflammatory Bowel Disease and Immune Thrombocytopenic Purpura.

He and his friendly staff are looking forward to meeting all the new patients!

                         Verified Patient Review

                        <path d="M283.7 82.8L154.5 208.6h-45.4V90.4h34.7v80.8S262.9 55.3 264.4 53.8C237 21.2 195.9.4 150 .4 67.4.4.2 67.6.2 150.2.2 232.8 67.4 300 150 300s149.8-67.2 149.8-149.8c0-24.2-5.8-47.1-16.1-67.4z" fill="#00E6AF">

                     <div class="sc-192nc1l-0 buuGUE i5k0wr-0 iDjpkc" data-test="collapsible-block" data-testid="statement-content">
                      Dr. Mejdi Ahmad is an accomplished gastroenterologist looking after the locals of Huntington, NY. Dr. Ahmad attended the State University of New York, Downstate Medical Center, where he received his medical degree. He then completed his residency in internal medicine at North Shore University Hospital. Additionally, he completed a fellowship in gastroenterology at Milton S. Hershey Medical Center.

Dr. Ahmad is certified by the American Board of Internal Medicine in both gastroenterology and internal medicine. He currently practices at Mount Sinai Doctors and is also an affiliate of the Mount Sinai Hospital. Patients visit him for the treatment of stomach ulcers, diarrhea, irritable bowel syndrome, and Crohns disease.

Dr. Ahmad believes that the patient-provider relationship should be built on mutual trust and that it plays a crucial part in patient care. He does his best to communicate the information patients need to make the right choices.
                      <div class="sc-192nc1l-1 ewhUaU hidden" data-test="children-wrap">

                   <div class="sc-192nc1l-0 buuGUE i5k0wr-0 iDjpkc" data-test="collapsible-block" data-testid="statement-content">
                    Dr. Mejdi Ahmad is an accomplished gastroenterologist looking after the locals of Huntington, NY. Dr. Ahmad attended the State University of New York, Downstate Medical Center, where he received his medical degree. He then completed his residency in internal medicine at North Shore University Hospital. Additionally, he completed a fellowship in gastroenterology at Milton S. Hershey Medical Center.

Dr. Ahmad is certified by the American Board of Internal Medicine in both gastroenterology and internal medicine. He currently practices at Mount Sinai Doctors and is also an affiliate of the Mount Sinai Hospital. Patients visit him for the treatment of stomach ulcers, diarrhea, irritable bowel syndrome, and Crohns disease.

Dr. Ahmad believes that the patient-provider relationship should be built on mutual trust and that it plays a crucial part in patient care. He does his best to communicate the information patients need to make the right choices.

                       <svg class="sc-14oxdvn-0 sc-138rgit-0 jMoswN sc-1nu7rd6-3 fqJBPx" data-test="review-verified-icon" viewbox="0 0 300 300" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
                        <title>
                         Verified Patient Review
                        </title>
                        <path d="M283.7 82.8L154.5 208.6h-45.4V90.4h34.7v80.8S262.9 55.3 264.4 53.8C237 21.2 195.9.4 150 .4 67.4.4.2 67.6.2 150.2.2 232.8 67.4 300 150 300s149.8-67.2 149.8-149.8c0-24.2-5.8-47.1-16.1-67.4z" fill="#00E6AF">

                     <div class="sc-192nc1l-0 buuGUE i5k0wr-0 iDjpkc" data-test="collapsible-block" data-testid="statement-content">
                      Jason Rubinov, MD, is a board-certified gastroenterologist in New York treating patients at the Mount Sinai Doctors practice in Williamsburg, Brooklyn. Dr. Rubinov has expertise in a wide range of gastrointestinal disorders and conditions including chronic acid reflux, irritable bowel syndrome, abdominal pain and gastrointestinal tract bleeding. He also has special expertise in inflammatory bowel disease, chronic liver conditions, colon cancer prevention, and diseases of the esophagus, including eosinophilic esophagitis and Barrett's esophagus. He is a native New Yorker born to Ukrainian immigrants, and has native fluency in both English and Russian.

Dr. Rubinov completed his undergraduate studies at New York University in Manhattan, New York. After completing his undergraduate studies, he went on to earn his medical degree from St. George's University, where he graduated Magna Cum Laude. Dr. Rubinov then completed his internal medicine internship and residency at Mount Sinai Beth Israel in Manhattan. After residency, Dr. Rubinov was selected amongst his peers to be Chief Resident at Mount Sinai Beth Israel and completed a fellowship in graduate medical education and administration. Following his year as Chief Resident, Dr. Rubinov went on to complete a fellowship in gastroenterology and hepatology at Mount Sinai Beth Israel, St. Luke's and West Hospitals. During his final year of fellowship, he was selected amongst his peers to be Chief Gastroenterology and Hepatology Fellow.

                    Jason Rubinov, MD, is a board-certified gastroenterologist in New York treating patients at the Mount Sinai Doctors practice in Williamsburg, Brooklyn. Dr. Rubinov has expertise in a wide range of gastrointestinal disorders and conditions including chronic acid reflux, irritable bowel syndrome, abdominal pain and gastrointestinal tract bleeding. He also has special expertise in inflammatory bowel disease, chronic liver conditions, colon cancer prevention, and diseases of the esophagus, including eosinophilic esophagitis and Barrett's esophagus. He is a native New Yorker born to Ukrainian immigrants, and has native fluency in both English and Russian.

Dr. Rubinov completed his undergraduate studies at New York University in Manhattan, New York. After completing his undergraduate studies, he went on to earn his medical degree from St. George's University, where he graduated Magna Cum Laude. Dr. Rubinov then completed his internal medicine internship and residency at Mount Sinai Beth Israel in Manhattan. After residency, Dr. Rubinov was selected amongst his peers to be Chief Resident at Mount Sinai Beth Israel and completed a fellowship in graduate medical education and administration. Following his year as Chief Resident, Dr. Rubinov went on to complete a fellowship in gastroenterology and hepatology at Mount Sinai Beth Israel, St. Luke's and West Hospitals. During his final year of fellowship, he was selected amongst his peers to be Chief Gastroenterology and Hepatology Fellow.

                   <div class="cg621t-9 biQrbq">
                    <svg class="sc-14oxdvn-0 cg621t-8 bWgswL" viewbox="0 0 51.6 43">
                     <svg class="sc-14oxdvn-0 uxxkcb-0 kCXcGp" data-test="filled-star-icon" viewbox="0 0 43 40">
                      <path d="M32.2 40l-10.7-7.8L10.8 40l-3.7-2.7 4.1-12.6L.5 17l1.4-4.4h13.2L19.2 0h4.6l4.1 12.6h13.2l1.4 4.4-10.7 7.8 4.1 12.6-3.7 2.6z" fill="#FF6473">
                      </path>
                     </svg>
                    </svg>
                    <div class="cg621t-10 fmVOcK" data-test="doctor-card-info-rating-number" itemprop="ratingValue">
                     4.88
                    </div>
                    <div class="sc-18es0tp-0 ctsRmo" data-test="doctor-card-review-explanation">
                     <span data-test="doctor-card-review-count" itemprop="reviewCount">
                      8
                     </span>
                     <span class="sc-18es0tp-2 bGDCIe">
                      verified
                      <!-- -->
                      reviews
                     </span>
                     <div class="sc-1r759f5-1 eyGcGf">
                      <svg class="sc-14oxdvn-0 puelyq-0 fJhWDW sc-18es0tp-1 bHCTsx" data-test="doctor-card-review-info-icon" viewbox="0 0 13 13">
                       <path d="M6.5 0A6.5 6.5 0 1 0 13 6.5 6.507 6.507 0 0 0 6.5 0zm0 11.96a5.46 5.46 0 1 1 5.46-5.46 5.466 5.466 0 0 1-5.46 5.46z" fill="#667385">
                       </path>
                       <path d="M5.72 3.12h1.56v1.56H5.72zm0 2.6h1.56v4.42H5.72z" fill="#667385">
                       </path>
                      </svg>
                      <div class="sc-1r759f5-0 krPbJc">
                       <div class="sc-114jkiy-2 sc-114jkiy-4 hQGvxh">
                        Zocdoc only allows patients to write reviews if we can verify they have seen the provider. Providers cant request to alter or remove reviews.

                  </div>
                  <div class="cg621t-12 gfNGpc">
                   <div class="sc-84gctr-0 jtwwNF">
                    <div class="sc-1kopvre-0 fZWIql">
                     <div class="sc-1nu7rd6-0 dtwjfK" data-testid="representative-review">
                      <div class="sc-1nu7rd6-2 esRIhU">
                       Recent Patient Review
                      </div>
                      <div class="sc-192nc1l-0 buuGUI sc-1nu7rd6-1 erocNn" data-test="collapsible-block">
                       "My was seen right away by the doctor,  friendly &amp; accommodating staff. Dr. Steven is very professional &amp; caring doctor. I would definitely recommend him to patient with GI problems."
                       <span class="sc-192nc1l-2 iLPFhr hidden" data-test="show-more-button">

                       <span class="sc-192nc1l-2 sc-192nc1l-3 irucWS hidden" data-test="show-less-button">
                        <span data-test="collapse-text">
                         ... read less
                        </span>
                       </span>
                      </div>
                      <div class="sc-1nu7rd6-4 jXipCC">
                       Jul 19, 2021 by
                       <!-- -->
                       <!-- -->
                       Brigette S.
                       <!-- -->
                       <svg class="sc-14oxdvn-0 sc-138rgit-0 jMoswN sc-1nu7rd6-3 fqJBPx" data-test="review-verified-icon" viewbox="0 0 300 300" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
                        <title>
                         Verified Patient Review
                        </title>
                        <path d="M283.7 82.8L154.5 208.6h-45.4V90.4h34.7v80.8S262.9 55.3 264.4 53.8C237 21.2 195.9.4 150 .4 67.4.4.2 67.6.2 150.2.2 232.8 67.4 300 150 300s149.8-67.2 149.8-149.8c0-24.2-5.8-47.1-16.1-67.4z" fill="#00E6AF">
                        </path>
                       </svg>
                      </div>
                     </div>
                     <div class="sc-192nc1l-0 buuGUE i5k0wr-0 iDjpkc" data-test="collapsible-block" data-testid="statement-content">
                      Steven Naymagon, MD
Why did you choose to specialize in gastroenterology?
I went to medical school knowing that I want to make a difference in peoples lives. As a medical student I was torn between two paths that would allow me to accomplish this goal  surgery and internal medicine. Surgery would allow me to assess and fix peoples acute problems in real time. Internal medicine would allow me to work out complex problems and develop longitudinal relationships with patients. And then I discovered gastroenterology! As a gastroenterologist I have been able to help patients with complex chronic conditions and see them through very trying times in their lives. I have also been able to perform urgent endoscopic procedures to treat bleeding ulcers, remove dangerous polyps, and relieve blockages in the gastrointestinal tract. These aspects of gastroenterology have led to a very fulfilling career and get me excited to come to work, meet new patients, and solve new problems every day.
What are your areas of special interest and expertise within gastroenterology?
While I practice general gastroenterology, I have been able to hone certain skills during my career. Training at The Mount Sinai Hospital, where Crohns disease was first described, led me to develop an interest in treating people with inflammatory bowel disease (Crohns disease and ulcerative colitis). I was fortunate to learn from some of the world leaders on the management of complex Crohns and colitis, and the skills I have learned continue to be part of my practice. In addition, since Crohns disease often involves the small intestine, I have spent additional time learning how to perform procedures to assess the small intestine  capsule endoscopy and double balloon small bowel enteroscopy. This combination of medical and interventional gastroenterology has been a great asset to my patients.
Do you have any special honors, recognition, or achievements in your medical career that you would like to share?
Being affiliated with a major medical center has allowed me to participate in the education of gastroenterology fellows and other trainees. I have been fortunate to receive the voluntary faculty teaching award from the GI fellowship on several occasions. In addition, I was lucky to be named the consultant of the year by my colleagues in the Division of Hospital Medicine. The ability to help my patients, my colleagues, and my students has been a true honor.
What do you and your family enjoy doing during your spare time?
As a city dweller, I look forward to getting out of the city! I enjoy going for a long hike in the woods and going skiing in the mountains. But I always come back to New York City with a great appreciation for what it has to offer, including the people, the arts, and the culture.
                      <div class="sc-192nc1l-1 ewhUaU hidden" data-test="children-wrap">

                          New York Gastroenterology Associates
                         </li>
                        </ul>

                        <title>
                         Verified Patient Review
                        </title>
                        <path d="M283.7 82.8L154.5 208.6h-45.4V90.4h34.7v80.8S262.9 55.3 264.4 53.8C237 21.2 195.9.4 150 .4 67.4.4.2 67.6.2 150.2.2 232.8 67.4 300 150 300s149.8-67.2 149.8-149.8c0-24.2-5.8-47.1-16.1-67.4z" fill="#00E6AF">
                        </path>

                     <div class="sc-192nc1l-0 buuGUE i5k0wr-0 iDjpkc" data-test="collapsible-block" data-testid="statement-content">
                      Jahnavi Naik is a concerned and caring gastroenterologist and internist serving the community of New York, NY. Dr. Naik obtained her medical degree from the University of Miami. She also completed her residency in internal medicine at Emory University and fellowship in gastroenterology at the University of Miami Hospital. 

Dr. Naik is a part of Mount Sinai Beth Israel. She is board certified in gastroenterology by the American Board of Internal Medicine. She speaks English and Gujarati. Her awareness of these different languages makes her accessible to patients from a variety of cultural backgrounds.

Patients trust Dr. Naik's expertise because she consistently provides high quality care that leads to positive and lasting health outcomes. She is sensitive to the uniqueness of each patient's situation and adapts her consultations and treatment options appropriately to accommodate individual needs and concerns.

Please arrive 15 minutes before your appointment time for important paperwork. We have a 15 minute late policy

                        <path d="M283.7 82.8L154.5 208.6h-45.4V90.4h34.7v80.8S262.9 55.3 264.4 53.8C237 21.2 195.9.4 150 .4 67.4.4.2 67.6.2 150.2.2 232.8 67.4 300 150 300s149.8-67.2 149.8-149.8c0-24.2-5.8-47.1-16.1-67.4z" fill="#00E6AF">

                     <div class="sc-192nc1l-0 buuGUE i5k0wr-0 iDjpkc" data-test="collapsible-block" data-testid="statement-content">
                      Dr. Aisenberg is a Clinical Professor of Medicine at The Mount Sinai Hospital, New York. He graduated from Harvard Medical School, trained in internal medicine at The Columbia-Presbyterian Medical Center and completed his gastroenterology fellowship at The Mount Sinai Hospital. His research focuses on gastrointestinal endoscopy and on the impact of common medications on digestive health. He has published over 100 articles, chapters, and abstracts in leading peer-reviewed journals and speaks nationally and internationally on gastrointestinal health and disease prevention. He is the President of the Digestive Disease Research Foundation. As featured in The New York Times, from 2003 through the present, he has been selected annually by his peers as a Top Doctor in New York in the field of gastroenterology.

                      <title>
                       Verified Patient Review
                      </title>
                      <path d="M283.7 82.8L154.5 208.6h-45.4V90.4h34.7v80.8S262.9 55.3 264.4 53.8C237 21.2 195.9.4 150 .4 67.4.4.2 67.6.2 150.2.2 232.8 67.4 300 150 300s149.8-67.2 149.8-149.8c0-24.2-5.8-47.1-16.1-67.4z" fill="#00E6AF">
                      </path>
                     </svg>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                   <div class="sc-192nc1l-0 buuGUE i5k0wr-0 iDjpkc" data-test="collapsible-block" data-testid="statement-content">
                    Dr. Aisenberg is a Clinical Professor of Medicine at The Mount Sinai Hospital, New York. He graduated from Harvard Medical School, trained in internal medicine at The Columbia-Presbyterian Medical Center and completed his gastroenterology fellowship at The Mount Sinai Hospital. His research focuses on gastrointestinal endoscopy and on the impact of common medications on digestive health. He has published over 100 articles, chapters, and abstracts in leading peer-reviewed journals and speaks nationally and internationally on gastrointestinal health and disease prevention. He is the President of the Digestive Disease Research Foundation. As featured in The New York Times, from 2003 through the present, he has been selected annually by his peers as a Top Doctor in New York in the field of gastroenterology.
                    <div class="sc-192nc1l-1 ewhUaU hidden" data-test="children-wrap">

                        <path d="M283.7 82.8L154.5 208.6h-45.4V90.4h34.7v80.8S262.9 55.3 264.4 53.8C237 21.2 195.9.4 150 .4 67.4.4.2 67.6.2 150.2.2 232.8 67.4 300 150 300s149.8-67.2 149.8-149.8c0-24.2-5.8-47.1-16.1-67.4z" fill="#00E6AF">

                     <div class="sc-192nc1l-0 buuGUE i5k0wr-0 iDjpkc" data-test="collapsible-block" data-testid="statement-content">
                      Dr. Aisenberg is a Clinical Professor of Medicine at The Mount Sinai Hospital, New York. He graduated from Harvard Medical School, trained in internal medicine at The Columbia-Presbyterian Medical Center and completed his gastroenterology fellowship at The Mount Sinai Hospital. His research focuses on gastrointestinal endoscopy and on the impact of common medications on digestive health. He has published over 100 articles, chapters, and abstracts in leading peer-reviewed journals and speaks nationally and internationally on gastrointestinal health and disease prevention. He is the President of the Digestive Disease Research Foundation. As featured in The New York Times, from 2003 through the present, he has been selected annually by his peers as a Top Doctor in New York in the field of gastroenterology.

He graduated from Harvard Medical School, trained in internal medicine at The Columbia-Presbyterian Medical Center and completed his gastroenterology fellowship at The Mount Sinai Hospital. His research focuses on gastrointestinal endoscopy and on the impact of common medications on digestive health.                          Verified Patient Review

                        <path d="M283.7 82.8L154.5 208.6h-45.4V90.4h34.7v80.8S262.9 55.3 264.4 53.8C237 21.2 195.9.4 150 .4 67.4.4.2 67.6.2 150.2.2 232.8 67.4 300 150 300s149.8-67.2 149.8-149.8c0-24.2-5.8-47.1-16.1-67.4z" fill="#00E6AF">

                     <div class="sc-192nc1l-0 buuGUE i5k0wr-0 iDjpkc" data-test="collapsible-block" data-testid="statement-content">
                      Arnold Rochwarger is a thorough and insightful internist and gastroenterologist based in New York, NY. Dr. Rochwarger earned his medical degree from the Albert Einstein College of Medicine of Yeshiva University and completed his residency training at the University of California San Francisco Medical Center. He also completed a fellowship program at the New York-Presbyterian Hospital, Weill Cornell Medical Center.

Dr. Rochwarger is certified in internal medicine and gastroenterology by the American Board of Internal Medicine. He is affiliated with the New York-Presbyterian Hospital, Weill Cornell Medical Center, where he holds admitting privileges and supervises consultation rounds with medical residents and fellows. He co-authored and published a book titled The Evolution and Treatment of the Patient with Diarrhoea. He also served in the US Army Corp from 1971 to 1973 as a major and doctor.

Dr. Rochwarger is a highly skilled diagnostician. His career is punctuated by many instances of successfully solving complicated medical diagnostic challenges. Some of the dysfunctions he has treated or managed include ulcerative colitis, diverticulitis, Crohns disease, colon cancer and biliary tract disorders. Outside of work, he enjoys spending time with his family, reading, and traveling. He is also fluent in English, Spanish, and Yiddish.

                   <a class="htzklx-16 cg621t-2 kuhtuQ" data-test="doctor-card-info-name" data-uem-id="doctor-card-info-name" href="/search?filters=%7B%7D&amp;dr_specialty=106&amp;reason_visit=386&amp;address=&amp;offset=0&amp;insurance_carrier=&amp;insurance_plan=&amp;highlightedProfileIds=%5B%22pr_Zvr55EKlSkW9KKn8eAwY5h%7Clo_jPAH5HR11ESZe_-pkH2w6R%22%5D&amp;canoe=true" rel="nofollow" tabindex="0" title="View the profile of Dr. Jonathan Kung, MD">
                    <h3>
                     <span data-test="doctor-card-info-name-prefix" itemprop="honorificPrefix">
                      Dr.
                     </span>
                     <span data-test="doctor-card-info-name-full" itemprop="name">

                   <div class="cg621t-6 cNOnWR" data-test="doctor-card-info-location-distance">

                      <div class="sc-1nu7rd6-4 jXipCC">
                       Apr 1, 2021 by
                       <!-- -->
                       <!-- -->
                       Xiomara L.
                       <!-- -->
                       <svg class="sc-14oxdvn-0 sc-138rgit-0 jMoswN sc-1nu7rd6-3 fqJBPx" data-test="review-verified-icon" viewbox="0 0 300 300" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
                        <title>
                         Verified Patient Review
                        </title>
                        <path d="M283.7 82.8L154.5 208.6h-45.4V90.4h34.7v80.8S262.9 55.3 264.4 53.8C237 21.2 195.9.4 150 .4 67.4.4.2 67.6.2 150.2.2 232.8 67.4 300 150 300s149.8-67.2 149.8-149.8c0-24.2-5.8-47.1-16.1-67.4z" fill="#00E6AF">
                        </path>
                       </svg>
                      </div>
                     </div>
                     <div class="sc-192nc1l-0 buuGUE i5k0wr-0 iDjpkc" data-test="collapsible-block" data-testid="statement-content">
                      Dr. Jonathan Kung studied Biology &amp; Exercise Biology as an undergraduate at the University of California, Davis. He shares knowing for some time as a young adult that he wanted to become a physician. This pursuit was further solidified in the summer before his final year of college in 2006 when he had the privilege to join a medical mission to Guatemala. Jonathan reports, I found a pure joy in meeting new people and hearing their stories, helping others, and contributing to the art of healing. 
Jonathan attended medical school at St. Georges University, and then completed Internal Medicine residency at Harbor UCLA Medical Center in 2015. He then completed Gastroenterology fellowship at the University of California, San Francisco-Fresno Medical Education Program in 2018. Finally, he completed an Advanced Therapeutic Endoscopy fellowship at Harbor UCLA Medical Center in 2019. Jonathan then completed a year of Gastroenterology in The Permanente Medical Group in the San Francisco Bay Area, before finally moving back to where his heart was  New York City!
Jonathan finds the specialty of Gastroenterology fascinating as it encompasses the entire body from mouth to colon. The close relationship between gastroenterologic specific organs and all other systems of the body is very unique. He also appreciates the key role of a gastroenterologist in preventing, diagnosing, and treating cancer early.
Jonathan says, I take pride in creating a comfortable and long-term trusting relationship with all my patients, with the goal to resolve any gastrointestinal disturbances to the best of my abilities while maintaining an environment where patients have full understanding of the diagnosis, thought process of evaluation, and reasons for treatment.
                      <div class="sc-192nc1l-1 ewhUaU hidden" data-test="children-wrap">

                   <div class="sc-192nc1l-0 buuGUE i5k0wr-0 iDjpkc" data-test="collapsible-block" data-testid="statement-content">
                    Dr. Jonathan Kung studied Biology &amp; Exercise Biology as an undergraduate at the University of California, Davis. He shares knowing for some time as a young adult that he wanted to become a physician. This pursuit was further solidified in the summer before his final year of college in 2006 when he had the privilege to join a medical mission to Guatemala. Jonathan reports, I found a pure joy in meeting new people and hearing their stories, helping others, and contributing to the art of healing. 
Jonathan attended medical school at St. Georges University, and then completed Internal Medicine residency at Harbor UCLA Medical Center in 2015. He then completed Gastroenterology fellowship at the University of California, San Francisco-Fresno Medical Education Program in 2018. Finally, he completed an Advanced Therapeutic Endoscopy fellowship at Harbor UCLA Medical Center in 2019. Jonathan then completed a year of Gastroenterology in The Permanente Medical Group in the San Francisco Bay Area, before finally moving back to where his heart was  New York City!
Jonathan finds the specialty of Gastroenterology fascinating as it encompasses the entire body from mouth to colon. The close relationship between gastroenterologic specific organs and all other systems of the body is very unique. He also appreciates the key role of a gastroenterologist in preventing, diagnosing, and treating cancer early.
Jonathan says, I take pride in creating a comfortable and long-term trusting relationship with all my patients, with the goal to resolve any gastrointestinal disturbances to the best of my abilities while maintaining an environment where patients have full understanding of the diagnosis, thought process of evaluation, and reasons for treatment.

                       <span class="sc-192nc1l-2 sc-192nc1l-3 irucWS hidden" data-test="show-less-button">
                        <span data-test="collapse-text">
                         ... read less

                      </div>
                      <div class="sc-1nu7rd6-4 jXipCC">
                       May 15, 2017 by

                       <svg class="sc-14oxdvn-0 sc-138rgit-0 jMoswN sc-1nu7rd6-3 fqJBPx" data-test="review-verified-icon" viewbox="0 0 300 300" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
                        <title>
                         Verified Patient Review
                        </title>
                        <path d="M283.7 82.8L154.5 208.6h-45.4V90.4h34.7v80.8S262.9 55.3 264.4 53.8C237 21.2 195.9.4 150 .4 67.4.4.2 67.6.2 150.2.2 232.8 67.4 300 150 300s149.8-67.2 149.8-149.8c0-24.2-5.8-47.1-16.1-67.4z" fill="#00E6AF">
                        </path>
                       </svg>
                      </div>

                     <div class="sc-192nc1l-0 buuGUE i5k0wr-0 iDjpkc" data-test="collapsible-block" data-testid="statement-content">
                      Dr. Crespin has been a practicing gastroenterologist in Manhattan for over ten years. Dr Crespin is a board certified gastroenterologist, who strives to provide the highest quality medical care and services in a compassionate, professional and personalized manner. 

Dr Crespin is expertly trained in endoscopic procedures, which allow direct visualization of the intestinal tract for optimal diagnosis, treatment, and prevention of gastrointestinal diseases. 

I treat a wide variety of conditions, including:

Screening for Colon Cancer 
Reflux Disease (Heartburn) 
Abdominal Pain 
Constipation 
Diarrhea 
Irritable Bowel Syndrome 
Swallowing Disorders 
Bloating 
Inflammatory Bowel Disease (Ulcerative Colitis and Crohns Disease) 
Hepatitis B 
Hepatitis C 
Other Diseases of the Liver 
Celiac Disease 

I am affiliated with NYU, Lenox Hill Hospital, located in the Upper East Side of Manhattan , St Lukes Roosevelt and Beth Israel Hospitals.

                    Dr. Crespin has been a practicing gastroenterologist in Manhattan for over ten years. Dr Crespin is a board certified gastroenterologist, who strives to provide the highest quality medical care and services in a compassionate, professional and personalized manner. 

Dr Crespin is expertly trained in endoscopic procedures, which allow direct visualization of the intestinal tract for optimal diagnosis, treatment, and prevention of gastrointestinal diseases.

                       <svg class="sc-14oxdvn-0 sc-138rgit-0 jMoswN sc-1nu7rd6-3 fqJBPx" data-test="review-verified-icon" viewbox="0 0 300 300" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
                        <title>
                         Verified Patient Review
                        </title>
                        <path d="M283.7 82.8L154.5 208.6h-45.4V90.4h34.7v80.8S262.9 55.3 264.4 53.8C237 21.2 195.9.4 150 .4 67.4.4.2 67.6.2 150.2.2 232.8 67.4 300 150 300s149.8-67.2 149.8-149.8c0-24.2-5.8-47.1-16.1-67.4z" fill="#00E6AF">

                     <div class="sc-192nc1l-0 buuGUE i5k0wr-0 iDjpkc" data-test="collapsible-block" data-testid="statement-content">
                      Dr. Desai is a Clinical Instructor of Medicine at Mount Sinai School of Medicine. He graduated with Research Honors from Tufts University School of Medicine. He subsequently completed his training in Internal Medicine and Gastroenterology at New York University. He has a strong clinical interest in Inflammatory Bowel Disease as well as Colorectal cancer screening. He also has expertise in managing gastrointestinal bleeding, acid reflux, abdominal pain syndromes, constipation, diarrhea, celiac disease, as well as liver disorders. 

His research interests have focused primarily on improving the performance of endoscopy and in studying the effects of commonly prescribed medication on the gastrointestinal tract. He has published extensively in leading gastroenterology journals as well as presented at national gastroenterology conferences, for which he has been recognized with several research awards.
                      <div class="sc-192nc1l-1 ewhUaU hidden" data-test="children-wrap">
                       <div class="st74kp-0 hUalqx">

                        </h4>

                         <li>
                          New York Gastroenterology Associates
                         </li>
                        </ul>

                         Board certifications

                         </li>
                        </ul>

                     Recent Patient Review
                    </div>
                    <div class="sc-192nc1l-0 buuGUI sc-1nu7rd6-1 erocNn" data-test="collapsible-block">
                     "Dr. Desai was excellent- friendly and reassuring.  I was seen right away."

                     Mar 1, 2017 by

                     <svg class="sc-14oxdvn-0 sc-138rgit-0 jMoswN sc-1nu7rd6-3 fqJBPx" data-test="review-verified-icon" viewbox="0 0 300 300" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
                      <title>
                       Verified Patient Review
                      </title>
                      <path d="M283.7 82.8L154.5 208.6h-45.4V90.4h34.7v80.8S262.9 55.3 264.4 53.8C237 21.2 195.9.4 150 .4 67.4.4.2 67.6.2 150.2.2 232.8 67.4 300 150 300s149.8-67.2 149.8-149.8c0-24.2-5.8-47.1-16.1-67.4z" fill="#00E6AF">
                      </path>
                     </svg>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                   <div class="sc-192nc1l-0 buuGUE i5k0wr-0 iDjpkc" data-test="collapsible-block" data-testid="statement-content">
                    Dr. Desai is a Clinical Instructor of Medicine at Mount Sinai School of Medicine. He graduated with Research Honors from Tufts University School of Medicine. He subsequently completed his training in Internal Medicine and Gastroenterology at New York University. He has a strong clinical interest in Inflammatory Bowel Disease as well as Colorectal cancer screening. He also has expertise in managing gastrointestinal bleeding, acid reflux, abdominal pain syndromes, constipation, diarrhea, celiac disease, as well as liver disorders. 

His research interests have focused primarily on improving the performance of endoscopy and in studying the effects of commonly prescribed medication on the gastrointestinal tract. He has published extensively in leading gastroenterology journals as well as presented at national gastroenterology conferences, for which he has been recognized with several research awards.

                        <title>
                         Verified Patient Review
                        </title>
                        <path d="M283.7 82.8L154.5 208.6h-45.4V90.4h34.7v80.8S262.9 55.3 264.4 53.8C237 21.2 195.9.4 150 .4 67.4.4.2 67.6.2 150.2.2 232.8 67.4 300 150 300s149.8-67.2 149.8-149.8c0-24.2-5.8-47.1-16.1-67.4z" fill="#00E6AF">

                     <div class="sc-192nc1l-0 buuGUE i5k0wr-0 iDjpkc" data-test="collapsible-block" data-testid="statement-content">
                      Dr. Rao is a highly trained highly rated, NYC gastroenterologist. Dr. Rao graduated from the renowned Columbia University with a degree in Biomedical Engineering and went on to receive a Master of Science from Yale University.  He then went on to obtain his medical degree from SUNY Health Science Center in Brooklyn and completed both his residency in internal medicine and a rigorous fellowship in gastroenterology and liver disease at the Stony Brook University Hospital. Dr. Rao merges his impressive academic accomplishments with his strong passion for patient care.  Dr. Rao is now affiliated with the world-renowned NY Presbyterian/Weill Cornell Medical Center. 

Dr. Rao has exhibited a passion for patient care in all stages of his illustrious training and career and enjoys it. Dr. Rao has excellent clinical skills and places a strong emphasis on his relationship with his patients. He enjoys educating them on their health and creating a strong doctor-patient relationship. This approach has made Dr. Rao a highly rated gastroenterologist and valued member of Manhattan Gastroenterology.

Dr. Rao specializes in the treatment of irritable bowel syndrome, hemorrhoid treatment, GERD/heartburn, inflammatory bowel disease and colon cancer prevention. Dr. Rao customizes his approach to each patient to ensure that their treatment is as effective as it can be in a compassionate and friendly environment. Dr. Rao is affiliated with NY Presbyterian/Weill Cornell Medical Center. Dr. Rao and his team look forward to meeting you!

                       <svg class="sc-14oxdvn-0 sc-138rgit-0 jMoswN sc-1nu7rd6-3 fqJBPx" data-test="review-verified-icon" viewbox="0 0 300 300" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
                        <title>
                         Verified Patient Review
                        </title>
                        <path d="M283.7 82.8L154.5 208.6h-45.4V90.4h34.7v80.8S262.9 55.3 264.4 53.8C237 21.2 195.9.4 150 .4 67.4.4.2 67.6.2 150.2.2 232.8 67.4 300 150 300s149.8-67.2 149.8-149.8c0-24.2-5.8-47.1-16.1-67.4z" fill="#00E6AF">

                     <div class="sc-192nc1l-0 buuGUE i5k0wr-0 iDjpkc" data-test="collapsible-block" data-testid="statement-content">
                      Dr. Jonathan Cohen graduated from Harvard College and Harvard Medical School.Dr. Cohen is currently a Clinical Professor of Medicine at NYU School of medicine.  He has co-authored numerous articles on his research findings in gastroenterology and endoscopy and presented results of his studies at several scientific meetings. He edited the textbook Comprehensive Atlas of High-Resolution Endoscopy and Narrowband Imaging.  A frequent lecturer, he has directed several courses at the national level and is a past President of the New York Society for Gastrointestinal Endoscopy. Dr. Cohen also has been named to the New York Super Doctors list for several consecutive years.

Co-Director of the of the Integrative Weight Management Program at Vanguard Gastroenterology, Dr. Cohen is dedicated to providing a holistic, intensive, yet convenient approach to help patients with obesity achieve their long term health goals.  In addition to providing general gastroenterology care, Dr. Cohen performs specialized advanced therapeutic endoscopy procedures such as ERCP, large polyp resection, Barretts ablation and endoscopic obesity procedures such as intragastric balloon placement, suture anastomosis revision for weight regain following gastric bypass surgery and ESG . He has an expertise in the field of disorders of the bile duct, pancreas, and liver.

No-Show/Cancellation Fees 
The office requires notice of at least (24 hours) 1 business day when cancelling an appointment. If you miss your appointment or do not cancel with the appropriate notice an additional fee will apply.

                       Apr 1, 2021 by

                       <!-- -->
                       <svg class="sc-14oxdvn-0 sc-138rgit-0 jMoswN sc-1nu7rd6-3 fqJBPx" data-test="review-verified-icon" viewbox="0 0 300 300" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
                        <title>
                         Verified Patient Review
                        </title>
                        <path d="M283.7 82.8L154.5 208.6h-45.4V90.4h34.7v80.8S262.9 55.3 264.4 53.8C237 21.2 195.9.4 150 .4 67.4.4.2 67.6.2 150.2.2 232.8 67.4 300 150 300s149.8-67.2 149.8-149.8c0-24.2-5.8-47.1-16.1-67.4z" fill="#00E6AF">

                     <div class="sc-192nc1l-0 buuGUE i5k0wr-0 iDjpkc" data-test="collapsible-block" data-testid="statement-content">
                      Dr. Jonathan Kung studied Biology &amp; Exercise Biology as an undergraduate at the University of California, Davis. He shares knowing for some time as a young adult that he wanted to become a physician. This pursuit was further solidified in the summer before his final year of college in 2006 when he had the privilege to join a medical mission to Guatemala. Jonathan reports, I found a pure joy in meeting new people and hearing their stories, helping others, and contributing to the art of healing. 
Jonathan attended medical school at St. Georges University, and then completed Internal Medicine residency at Harbor UCLA Medical Center in 2015. He then completed Gastroenterology fellowship at the University of California, San Francisco-Fresno Medical Education Program in 2018. Finally, he completed an Advanced Therapeutic Endoscopy fellowship at Harbor UCLA Medical Center in 2019. Jonathan then completed a year of Gastroenterology in The Permanente Medical Group in the San Francisco Bay Area, before finally moving back to where his heart was  New York City!
Jonathan finds the specialty of Gastroenterology fascinating as it encompasses the entire body from mouth to colon. The close relationship between gastroenterologic specific organs and all other systems of the body is very unique. He also appreciates the key role of a gastroenterologist in preventing, diagnosing, and treating cancer early.
Jonathan says, I take pride in creating a comfortable and long-term trusting relationship with all my patients, with the goal to resolve any gastrointestinal disturbances to the best of my abilities while maintaining an environment where patients have full understanding of the diagnosis, thought process of evaluation, and reasons for treatment.

                   <div class="sc-192nc1l-0 buuGUE i5k0wr-0 iDjpkc" data-test="collapsible-block" data-testid="statement-content">
                    Dr. Jonathan Kung studied Biology &amp; Exercise Biology as an undergraduate at the University of California, Davis. He shares knowing for some time as a young adult that he wanted to become a physician. This pursuit was further solidified in the summer before his final year of college in 2006 when he had the privilege to join a medical mission to Guatemala. Jonathan reports, I found a pure joy in meeting new people and hearing their stories, helping others, and contributing to the art of healing. 
Jonathan attended medical school at St. Georges University, and then completed Internal Medicine residency at Harbor UCLA Medical Center in 2015. He then completed Gastroenterology fellowship at the University of California, San Francisco-Fresno Medical Education Program in 2018. Finally, he completed an Advanced Therapeutic Endoscopy fellowship at Harbor UCLA Medical Center in 2019. Jonathan then completed a year of Gastroenterology in The Permanente Medical Group in the San Francisco Bay Area, before finally moving back to where his heart was  New York City!
Jonathan finds the specialty of Gastroenterology fascinating as it encompasses the entire body from mouth to colon. The close relationship between gastroenterologic specific organs and all other systems of the body is very unique. He also appreciates the key role of a gastroenterologist in preventing, diagnosing, and treating cancer early.
Jonathan says, I take pride in creating a comfortable and long-term trusting relationship with all my patients, with the goal to resolve any gastrointestinal disturbances to the best of my abilities while maintaining an environment where patients have full understanding of the diagnosis, thought process of evaluation, and reasons for treatment.

                      <div class="sc-1r759f5-0 krPbJc">
                       <div class="sc-114jkiy-2 sc-114jkiy-4 hQGvxh">
                        Zocdoc only allows patients to write reviews if we can verify they have seen the provider. Providers cant request to alter or remove reviews.
